hanzi-su-wiki:
環

Значения

Кольцо, круг; вращение

Мнемоника

Кольцо из яшмы 王. Справа — крутиться в кринолине перед зеркалом, оглядывая 目 себя со всех сторон. Кринолин есть длинная одежда 衣 с высоким поясом 囗.

Варианты

环, 𤨔

heisig_chinese_memo: First we have a jewel. Next we have the great eye of Sauron searching for the fellowship hiding under the many ceilings during their journey. The fourth and fifth primitives are the mouth of Gollum always mumbling “My preciousss ring”
heisig_constituent: ring, king, jewel, ball, trampoline, eye, cross-eyed, net, one, ceiling, mouth, scarf
heisig_story: Jewel . . . eye . . . ceiling . . . mouth . . . scarf. The number of elements is large here, so take extra care. Learn it in conjunction with the next frame, since these are the only two cases in this book where the combination of elements to the right appears.
koohiiStory1: Together with the next kanji, the keywords spell “send back the ring”. First we have a jewel. Next we have the great eye of Sauron searching for the fellowship hiding under the many ceilings during their journey. The fourth and fifth primitives are the mouth of Gollum always mumbling “My preciousss”; and Pippin´s scarf! Placement: the eye appears at the top similarly to how the Great Eye of Sauron is perched atop the Dark Tower.
koohiiStory2: In conjunction with send back (#837)....... When I tried to give her the jewel ring, she eyed me, threw it to the floor, opened her mouth and tried to speak, she said nothing. She grabbed her scarf and left.
jp_example_words:
環境(かんきょう): environment, circumstance
循環(じゅんかん): circulation, rotation, cycle
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The king is showing his people how to put a net around a weird zombie by walking around it in a loop.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Watch as the king loops the net around and around and around the zombie, keeping it completely pinned down.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The king also explains that this loop technique was used by Genghis Khan (かん) when he was conquering cities. He'd loop around the entire place with a net and trap them.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Genghis Khan looping around and around just like the king is looping around and around this zombie.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 口 (рот), 王 (монарх), 買 (покупать), 衣 (одежда)
Ru_trainchinese: huán: (сущ/глаг) кольцо, круг, петля; кольцо мишени; звено, часть целого; окружать, опоясывать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the stares (睘) by the king (王) surround him
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: No one has rings like the king.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: In the late Western Zhou Dynasty, the inscriptions from " Jade ", " Sai " or " Yuan " sound, the ancient form sounds of " Sai " and " Yuan " are very close. As the radicals of ancient characters, there are " Sai " and " Yuan ". Circumstances (see " Yuan " for details); Xiao Zhuan starts with " Jade " and " Luo " sounds. Early Western Zhou Dynasty Bronze writing " Qiong ", " Qiong 'from the' Si 'from the' ◎ 'from the' clothing ', the original meaning is Yuhuan. Later, in order to clarify the meaning of the word, the symbol " Jade " was added next to "睘" to indicate a ring made of jade. "睘" is used not only as a musical note , but also as an ideographic function, indicating that the " ring " is round. "Shuowen": "Ring, Bi Ye. Meat is as good as a ring." " Fu " and " Good " respectively refer to the peripheral and middle holes of the ring. Guo Pu's note in "Erya": "Side, Kong Shi, etc. "It means that the circumference of the jade is about the same width as the bi-hole, which is called a " ring ".

The original meaning of " ring " is jade bi, with a hole in the middle of the circle. It was mostly used as a symbol or decoration in ancient times. "Xunzi. "Roughly speaking": "A man who is absolutely guilty, but a ring is not." Yang Jie's note: "The ancients, the minister is guilty, wait to be put in the environment, and dare not go for three years. It means that the guilty courtiers in ancient times would be exiled to the border of the country and would not dare to leave for three years. If the monarch gave Yuhuan, he could go back; if he was given Yujue, he could not leave. Later generations used "Huan Ju" as a metaphor for officials' internal calling and external demotion; see " Juan ". Later, it generally refers to things with a hole in the center, such as wreaths, earrings, and rings. It is also extended to mean the surroundings and surroundings. "tube. "Light and Heavy Ding": "Please make the emperor's official ring and guard it." This sentence refers to the appointment of the emperor's official to pile up soil and plant trees around to guard the capital. It is also interpreted as a cycle. "Historical Records. "The Dao of the Three Kings": "If the three kings cycle, they will come and go." The "three kings" are Dayu, Shangtang, Zhou Wenwang, and Zhou Wu. The "three kings" refers to the emperor's way of these Ming monarchs; this sentence means ancient times Mingjun's emperor's way is like a loop back and forth, without stopping.

Derived from the outer form of " ring " as a verb, which means to encircle and encircle. "Mandarin. "In Yue Chinese": "The three rivers are surrounded by the people, and the people can't move." Wei Zhao's note: "Circle, go around." It means that Wujiang, Qiantang River and Puyang River surround Wu and Yue, and the people of the two countries cannot move. "Mencius. "Gongsun Chouxia": "The city of three miles, the Guo of Qili, and it is invincible." It means that there is an inner city of three miles, and the city of Qili surrounds the city to attack it, but cannot win.

Bronze writing is used as the original meaning. Mao Gongding: "Yuhuan", while Fansheng Guigai wrote "Yu Sui".

During the Warring States Period, the word " ring " had multiple meanings. Chu Jian is used as a measure word for jade. "Baoshan Chujian. Documents" Jian 213: "Prepare (Wai) a ring of jade." Qin bamboo slips are interpreted as surrounding. "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book A Type, Jian 21 back: "It is unlucky for the road to turn around the world." " Yu " refers to the house; it means that it is unlucky to have roads around the house.

The Han silk book is interpreted as a cycle. "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 110th line of the Old Unused Book before the second volume of Lao Zi: "It can be done or not, the sky is around the week, and the person is the guest." It means that when you move, you will be in a passive position again in the cycle of heaven. (See Chen Guying). Chinese silk book by " also " to " ring " is intended to surround the work. "Mawangdui. "Fifty-two sick prescriptions" line 101: "Take the mud from the well and seal the wound with the (ring)." That is, to surround the wound with the mud from the well. Duan Yucai's note on "Shuowen": "Hai, today people still use "huan" around the word, but the ancient scriptures only use the word "回"." Therefore, it can also be seen in the handed down literature that "huo" is written as "huan around". Chinese silk book also borrow more common " ring " to " also " construed return to righteousness. "Mawangdui Silk Book. "Chunqiu Shiyu" line 52: "Xiangongzhishi (division) attacked Guo (Guo) ring (return)." It means that Jin Xiangong's army returned after attacking Guoguo. Also used as transfer meaning. "Mawangdui Silk Book. "Warring States Political Strategists" line 278: "Yu (and) Yan is turned in, and the Qin disaster case is returned (returned) to Zhao Xi." It means that (Qin) and Yan have become friendly countries, and Qin has transferred the disaster To Zhao Guo.
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: In the late Western Zhou Dynasty, the inscriptions from " Jade ", "睘" sound; Xiaozhuan from " Jade ", "瞏" sound. "睘" is used not only as a musical note , but also as an ideographic function, indicating that the " ring " is round. The original meaning is Yuhuan and Yubi.
humanum_full_description:
西周晚期金文從「玉」，「睘」聲或「袁」聲，「睘」、「袁」古形音極近，作為古文字的偏旁，有「睘」、「袁」不分的情況（詳見「袁」字）；小篆從「玉」，「瞏」聲。西周早期金文寫作「睘」，「睘」從「罒」從「◎」從「衣」，本義是玉環。後來為了明確字義，在「睘」旁增加意符「玉」，表示以玉製成的環。「睘」既用作聲符，亦兼有表意作用，表示「環」是圓形的。《說文》：「環，璧也。肉好若一謂之環。」「肉」、「好」分別指環的周邊和中間的孔，郭璞注《爾雅》：「邊、孔適等。」即是玉的周邊和璧孔寬度相約就稱之為「環」。

　　「環」本義為玉璧，圓形中間有孔，古代多用作符信或裝飾品。《荀子．大略》：「絕人以玦，反絕以環。」楊倞注：「古者，臣有罪，待放於境，三年不敢去，與之環則還，與之玦則絕。」意指古時有罪的臣子會流放到國家的邊境，三年不敢離開，若君主賜予玉環，則可以歸去；若賜予玉玦，則表示不可以離開。後世以「環玦」比喻官員的內召和外貶；參見「玦」。後來泛指圓形中間有孔的東西，如花環、耳環、指環等。又引申作四周、周圍之意。《管子．輕重丁》：「請使天子之吏環封而守之。」這句指請指派天子的官吏在周圍堆土植樹，以守衛都城。亦引申解作循環。《史記．高祖本紀》：「三王之道若循環，終而復始。」「三王」即是大禹、商湯、周文王和周武王，「三王之道」指的是這些明君的帝王之道；這句表示古代明君的帝王之道如迴環往復，沒有止息。

　　從「環」之外形引申作動詞，表示環繞、包圍之意。《國語．越語上》：「三江環之，民無所移。」韋昭注：「環，繞也。」意指吳江、錢塘江和浦陽江圍繞吳越兩國，兩國的百姓無可遷移。《孟子．公孫丑下》：「三里之城，七里之郭，環而攻之而不勝。」意謂有三里的內城，七里的城郭，包圍着這座城攻打它，卻不能取勝。

　　金文用作本義。毛公鼎：「玉環」，而番生簋蓋則寫作「玉睘」。

　　戰國時，「環」字已有多個詞義。楚簡用作玉器的量詞。《包山楚簡．文書》簡213：「備（佩）玉一環。」秦簡解作環繞。《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡21背：「道周環宇，不吉。」「宇」指房屋；表示房屋的四周有道路環繞是不吉利的。

　　漢帛書解作循環。《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本卷前古佚書》第110行：「可作不作，天稽環周，人反之為客。」意指該動時不動，在天道的循環運行中，人就會重新處於被動地位（參陳鼓應）。漢帛書借「還」為「環」，作環繞之意。《馬王堆．五十二病方》第101行：「取井中泥，以還（環）封其傷。」即是用井中的泥土，包圍傷口。段玉裁注《說文》：「還，今人還繞字用『環』，古經傳祇用『還』字。」故傳世文獻中亦可見「環繞」寫作「還繞」。漢帛書亦多見借「環」為「還」，解作返回義。《馬王堆帛書．春秋事語》第52行：「獻公之帀（師）襲郭（虢）環（還）。」意指晉獻公的軍隊攻打虢國後回來了。又用作轉移義。《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書》第278行：「餘（與）燕為上交，秦禍案環（還）歸於趙矣。」意謂（秦國）與燕國成為友好之國，秦國把禍患轉移給趙國。
humanum_short_description: 西周晚期金文從「玉」，「睘」聲；小篆從「玉」，「瞏」聲。「睘」既用作聲符，亦兼有表意作用，表示「環」是圓形的。本義是玉環、玉璧。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
環 (Simplified: 环)
Pinyin: huán
English Definition: ring; hoop; loop; (chain) link; classifier for scores in archery etc; to surround; to encircle; to hem in
Total strokes: 17; Radical: 玉
Pictophonetic: 睘 indicates the sound; 王 (jade) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 王 [ wáng ] king, ruler; royal; surname
    • 睘 [ qióng ] round; to stare
Example Words:
環境 [ huán jìng ]: environment; circumstances; surroundings; Classifiers: 个 ; ambient
環節 [ huán jié ]: (zoology) segment (of the body of a worm, centipede etc); (fig.) a part of an integrated whole: aspect (of a project), element (of a policy), sector (of the economy), stage (of a process), etc
環保 [ huán bǎo ]: environmental protection; environmentally friendly; abbr. for 环境保护
環球 [ huán qiú ]: around the world; worldwide
More: 環* | *環 | *環*
hanziyuan:
Traditional in your browser 繁体字的浏览器显示:環

Traditional in Unicode standard 繁体字的Unicode标准:U+74B0

Older traditional characters 旧繁体字/异体字: 𤪹

Simplified in your browser 简体字的浏览器显示:环

Simplified in Unicode standard 简体字的Unicode标准:U+73AF

Main pronunciation 主要发音: huán

Other pronunciations 其它发音: Not exists.

Original meaning 本义: Meaning a jade ring or bracelet.

English senses 英语理解: jade ring or bracelet; ring

Usage example 用法举例: 循環 xún huán (circulate)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 795

Shuowen 说文解字: 璧也肉好若一謂之環從玉睘聲

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 環 𤪹 huán from (rem- 王 wáng) from jade 玉 yù and (rem- 不 bù cursive) from related phonetic round-bi 睘瞏 huán A097 环[環] new-char 环.

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :

Simplification rule : A097 环[環]

Simplification rule explained :
new-char cursive 不睘 环環 (bracelet)

Variant rule : C000

Applied rules :

西周晚期金文從「 玉 」，「 睘 」聲或「 袁 」聲，「 睘 」、「 袁 」古形音極近，作為古文字的偏旁，有「 睘 」、「 袁 」不分的情況（詳見「 袁 」字）；小篆從「 玉 」，「 瞏 」聲。西周早期金文寫作「 睘 」，「 睘 」從「 罒 」從「 ◎ 」從「 衣 」，本義是玉環。後來為了明確字義，在「 睘 」旁增加意符「 玉 」，表示以玉製成的環。「 睘 」既用作聲符，亦兼有表意作用，表示「 環 」是圓形的。《說文》：「環，璧也。肉好若一謂之環。」「 肉 」、「 好 」分別指環的周邊和中間的孔，郭璞注《爾雅》：「邊、孔適等。」即是玉的周邊和璧孔寬度相約就稱之為「 環 」。 「 環 」本義為玉璧，圓形中間有孔，古代多用作符信或裝飾品。《荀子．大略》：「絕人以玦，反絕以環。」楊倞注：「古者，臣有罪，待放於境，三年不敢去，與之環則還，與之玦則絕。」意指古時有罪的臣子會流放到國家的邊境，三年不敢離開，若君主賜予玉環，則可以歸去；若賜予玉玦，則表示不可以離開。後世以「環玦」比喻官員的內召和外貶；參見「 玦 」。後來泛指圓形中間有孔的東西，如花環、耳環、指環等。又引申作四周、周圍之意。《管子．輕重丁》：「請使天子之吏環封而守之。」這句指請指派天子的官吏在周圍堆土植樹，以守衛都城。亦引申解作循環。《史記．高祖本紀》：「三王之道若循環，終而復始。」「三王」即是大禹、商湯、周文王和周武王，「三王之道」指的是這些明君的帝王之道；這句表示古代明君的帝王之道如迴環往復，沒有止息。 從「 環 」之外形引申作動詞，表示環繞、包圍之意。《國語．越語上》：「三江環之，民無所移。」韋昭注：「環，繞也。」意指吳江、錢塘江和浦陽江圍繞吳越兩國，兩國的百姓無可遷移。《孟子．公孫丑下》：「三里之城，七里之郭，環而攻之而不勝。」意謂有三里的內城，七里的城郭，包圍着這座城攻打它，卻不能取勝。 金文用作本義。毛公鼎：「玉環」，而番生簋蓋則寫作「玉睘」。 戰國時，「 環 」字已有多個詞義。楚簡用作玉器的量詞。《包山楚簡．文書》簡213：「備（佩）玉一環。」秦簡解作環繞。《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡21背：「道周環宇，不吉。」「 宇 」指房屋；表示房屋的四周有道路環繞是不吉利的。 漢帛書解作循環。《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本卷前古佚書》第110行：「可作不作，天稽環周，人反之為客。」意指該動時不動，在天道的循環運行中，人就會重新處於被動地位（參陳鼓應）。漢帛書借「 還 」為「 環 」，作環繞之意。《馬王堆．五十二病方》第101行：「取井中泥，以還（環）封其傷。」即是用井中的泥土，包圍傷口。段玉裁注《說文》：「還，今人還繞字用『環』，古經傳祇用『還』字。」故傳世文獻中亦可見「環繞」寫作「還繞」。漢帛書亦多見借「 環 」為「 還 」，解作返回義。《馬王堆帛書．春秋事語》第52行：「獻公之帀（師）襲郭（虢）環（還）。」意指晉獻公的軍隊攻打虢國後回來了。又用作轉移義。《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書》第278行：「餘（與）燕為上交，秦禍案環（還）歸於趙矣。」意謂（秦國）與燕國成為友好之國，秦國把禍患轉移給趙國。
Elaboration: In the late Western Zhou Dynasty, the inscriptions from " Jade", " Sai" or " Yuan" sound, the ancient form sounds of " Sai" and " Yuan" are very close. As the radicals of ancient characters, there are " Sai" and " Yuan". Circumstances (see " Yuan" for details); Xiao Zhuan starts with " Jade" and " Luo" sounds. Early Western Zhou Dynasty Bronze writing " Qiong", " Qiong 'from the' Si 'from the' ◎ 'from the' clothing ', the original meaning is Yuhuan. Later, in order to clarify the meaning of the word, the symbol " Jade" was added next to " 睘" to indicate a ring made of jade. " 睘" is used not only as a musical note, but also as an ideographic function, indicating that the " ring" is round. "Shuowen": "Ring, Bi Ye. Meat is as good as a ring." " Fu" and " Good" respectively refer to the peripheral and middle holes of the ring. Guo Pu's note in "Erya": "Side, Kong Shi, etc. "It means that the circumference of the jade is about the same width as the bi-hole, which is called a " ring". The original meaning of " ring" is jade bi, with a hole in the middle of the circle. It was mostly used as a symbol or decoration in ancient times. "Xunzi. "Roughly speaking": "A man who is absolutely guilty, but a ring is not." Yang Jie's note: "The ancients, the minister is guilty, wait to be put in the environment, and dare not go for three years. It means that the guilty courtiers in ancient times would be exiled to the border of the country and would not dare to leave for three years. If the monarch gave Yuhuan, he could go back; if he was given Yujue, he could not leave. Later generations used "Huan Ju" as a metaphor for officials' internal calling and external demotion; see " Juan". Later, it generally refers to things with a hole in the center, such as wreaths, earrings, and rings. It is also extended to mean the surroundings and surroundings. "tube. "Light and Heavy Ding": "Please make the emperor's official ring and guard it." This sentence refers to the appointment of the emperor's official to pile up soil and plant trees around to guard the capital. It is also interpreted as a cycle. "Historical Records. "The Dao of the Three Kings": "If the three kings cycle, they will come and go." The "three kings" are Dayu, Shangtang, Zhou Wenwang, and Zhou Wu. The "three kings" refers to the emperor's way of these Ming monarchs; this sentence means ancient times Mingjun's emperor's way is like a loop back and forth, without stopping. Derived from the outer form of " ring" as a verb, which means to encircle and encircle. "Mandarin. "In Yue Chinese": "The three rivers are surrounded by the people, and the people can't move." Wei Zhao's note: "Circle, go around." It means that Wujiang, Qiantang River and Puyang River surround Wu and Yue, and the people of the two countries cannot move. "Mencius. "Gongsun Chouxia": "The city of three miles, the Guo of Qili, and it is invincible." It means that there is an inner city of three miles, and the city of Qili surrounds the city to attack it, but cannot win. Bronze writing is used as the original meaning. Mao Gongding: "Yuhuan", while Fansheng Guigai wrote "Yu Sui". During the Warring States Period, the word " ring" had multiple meanings. Chu Jian is used as a measure word for jade. "Baoshan Chujian. Documents" Jian 213: "Prepare (Wai) a ring of jade." Qin bamboo slips are interpreted as surrounding. "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book A Type, Jian 21 back: "It is unlucky for the road to turn around the world." " Yu" refers to the house; it means that it is unlucky to have roads around the house. The Han silk book is interpreted as a cycle. "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 110th line of the Old Unused Book before the second volume of Lao Zi: "It can be done or not, the sky is around the week, and the person is the guest." It means that when you move, you will be in a passive position again in the cycle of heaven. (See Chen Guying). Chinese silk book by " also" to " ring" is intended to surround the work. "Mawangdui. "Fifty-two sick prescriptions" line 101: "Take the mud from the well and seal the wound with the (ring)." That is, to surround the wound with the mud from the well. Duan Yucai's note on "Shuowen": "Hai, today people still use "huan" around the word, but the ancient scriptures only use the word "回"." Therefore, it can also be seen in the handed down literature that "huo" is written as "huan around". Chinese silk book also borrow more common " ring" to " also" construed return to righteousness. "Mawangdui Silk Book. "Chunqiu Shiyu" line 52: "Xiangongzhishi (division) attacked Guo (Guo) ring (return)." It means that Jin Xiangong's army returned after attacking Guoguo. Also used as transfer meaning. "Mawangdui Silk Book. "Warring States Political Strategists" line 278: "Yu (and) Yan is turned in, and the Qin disaster case is returned (returned) to Zhao Xi." It means that (Qin) and Yan have become friendly countries, and Qin has transferred the disaster To Zhao Guo.

環字的汉语字典释义

[①]［huán］
［《廣韻》户關切，平删，匣。］
“环1”的繁体字。
(1)璧的一种。圆圈形的玉器。
(2)泛指圆圈形的物品。
(3)比喻漩涡。
(4)旋转。
(5)围绕。
(6)包围。
(7)包含，包蕴。
(8)周遍。
(9)环节，互相关联的事物中的一个。
(10)长宽相等。参见“環幅”。
(11)古代重量单位。同“鍰”。
(12)通“營”。谋求。
(13)通“營”。荧惑。参见“環主”。
(14)姓。战国楚有环渊。见《史记·孟子荀卿列传》。
[②]［huàn］
［《集韻》胡慣切，去諫，匣。］
“环2”的繁体字。通“還1”。
击退，使退却。

環字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【玉字部】　環； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页743第17
【唐韻】戸關切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】胡關切，?音還。【說文】璧屬也。【玉篇】玉環。【爾雅·釋器】肉好若一謂之環。【註】邊孔適等。【禮·經解】行步則有環佩之聲。【註】環取其無窮。　又【玉篇】繞也。【正韻】回繞也。【禮·雜記】小斂環絰。【疏】環絰是周回纏繞之名。【周禮·冬官考工記】環涂七軌。【註】故書環或作轘，環涂謂環城之道。　又【周禮·春官·樂師】環拜以鐘鼓爲節。【註】環，猶旋也。　又【儀禮·士喪禮】布巾環幅不鑿。【註】環幅廣袤等也。　又【釋名】刀本曰環，形似環也。　又【詩·秦風】游環脅驅。【傳】游環，靷環也。　又【周禮·冬官考工記】良鼓瑕如積環。【疏】瑕與環皆謂漆之文理。　又姓。【史記·田敬仲世家】環淵之徒七十六人。【註】楚人孟子傳云：環淵著書上下篇。【五音集韻】古有楚賢者環淵，後有環齊，撰要略一部。　又人名。【左傳·襄十四年】今余命女環。【註】齊靈公名。【戰國策】楚王問於范環。【釋文】環，史作蠉。　又官名。【左傳·文元年】且掌環列之尹。【註】

環字的源字形

字源演变：

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
環字的起名意思

同“环”，指圆形而中间有孔的玉器，如环佩，环琨，环塡等。

Old glyph
ring
Name meaning
Same as "ring", refers to jade articles that are round and have a hole in the middle, such as ring wear, ring kun, ring sill, etc.
huán, huàn
вм. 环
Radicals: 王, 罒  (king, net, zombie)
Meaning Mnemonic
The king is showing his people how to put a net around a weird zombie by walking around it in a loop.
Watch as the king loops the net around and around and around the zombie, keeping it completely pinned down.
Reading Mnemonic
The king also explains that this loop technique was used by Genghis Khan (かん) when he was conquering cities. He'd loop around the entire place with a net and trap them.
Picture Genghis Khan looping around and around just like the king is looping around and around this zombie.
